para.name: NRRUN
para.desc: Run number of this simulation. This number is used to form part of the name of the various output files.

para.name: SHOWNO
para.desc: Event number of first shower. The second shower will get number SHOWNO+1 and so on.

para.name: ISEED1
para.desc: Contains the seed of the random number sequence.

para.name: ISEED2
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization.

para.name: ISEED3
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization times 10^9. Should be avoided because of cinsiderable computing time.

para.name: ISEED1
para.desc: Contains the seed of the random number sequence.

para.name: ISEED2
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization.

para.name: ISEED3
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization times 10^9. Should be avoided because of cinsiderable computing time.

para.name: ISEED1
para.desc: Contains the seed of the random number sequence.

para.name: ISEED2
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization.

para.name: ISEED3
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization times 10^9. Should be avoided because of cinsiderable computing time.

setting.name: SEED4
setting.desc: Random Number Generator Initialization (Offset of telescope systems)

para.name: ISEED1
para.desc: Contains the seed of the random number sequence.

para.name: ISEED2
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization.

para.name: ISEED3
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization times 10^9. Should be avoided because of cinsiderable computing time.

setting.name: SEED5
setting.desc: Random Number Generator Initialization (offset scattering to Auger core)

para.name: ISEED1
para.desc: Contains the seed of the random number sequence.

para.name: ISEED2
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization.

para.name: ISEED3
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization times 10^9. Should be avoided because of cinsiderable computing time.

para.name: ISEED1
para.desc: Contains the seed of the random number sequence.

para.name: ISEED2
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization.

para.name: ISEED3
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization times 10^9. Should be avoided because of cinsiderable computing time.

para.name: ISEED1
para.desc: Contains the seed of the random number sequence.

para.name: ISEED2
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization.

para.name: ISEED3
para.desc: Number of calls to the RNG for initialization times 10^9. Should be avoided because of cinsiderable computing time.

para.name: NSHOW
para.desc: Number of showers to be generated in a run.

para.name: PRMPAR
para.desc: Particle format of the primary particle. See Table 4 (page 110) for the particle codes in the userguide.

setting.name: ERANGE
setting.desc: Energy Range: If LLIMIT = ULIMIT, the primary energy is fixed at this value.

para.name: LLIMIT
para.desc: Lower limit of the primary particle energy range (in GeV). The primary energy is selected at random out of this interval. For detailed limits see page 65 in the userguide.

para.name: ULIMIT
para.desc: Upper limit of the primary particle energy range (in GeV). The primary energy is selected at random out of this interval. For detailed limits see page 65 in the userguide.

para.name: PSLOPE
para.desc: Exponent gamma of differential primary energy spectrum. PSLOPE has no meaning in case of fixed primary energy. The energies are total energies and include the particle rest mass.

setting.name: THETAP
setting.desc: Zenith Angle Definition: THETPR is the angle of incidence at a horizontal detector. THETPR = 0 is vertical.

para.name: THETPR1
para.desc: Low edge of zenith angle range of primary particle (in degree).

para.name: THETPR2
para.desc: High edge of zenith angle range of primary particle (in degree).

setting.name: PHIP
setting.desc: Azimuth Angle Definition: For 0 degree the shower axis points to magnetic North, for 90 degree it points to West, see Fig. 1 (page 108).

para.name: PHIPR1
para.desc: Low edge of azimuth angle range of primary particle (in degree).

para.name: PHIPR2
para.desc: High edge of azimuth angle range of primary particle (in degree).

setting.name: VIEWCONE
setting.desc: Viewing Cone Specifications: The VIEWCONE option (see Sect. 3.5.34 page 60) selects the direction of primaries in a circular cone around the fixed primary direction.

para.name: VUECON1
para.desc: Inner limiting angle of viewing cone (in degree).

para.name: VUECON2
para.desc: Outer limiting angle of viewing cone (in degree).

para.name: THICK0
para.desc: The starting altitude (in g/cm^2 mass overburden) of the primary particle is set for all showers. This choice is not effective if the height of the first interaction is set by FIXHEI > 0. (see Sect. 4.13 below). With this keyword the development of sub-showers starting at the chosen altitude within the atmosphere may be followed. The starting altitude must be above the lowest observation level.

para.name: HIMPACT1
para.desc: Lower value (in cm) for minimum altitude of horizontal shower axis.

para.name: HIMPACT2
para.desc: Upper value (in cm) for minimum altitude of horizontal shower axis.

para.name: FILOUT
para.desc: File name to define the name and directory of the output file which will contain the parameters of the secondary particles produced in the first interaction. These particles are written only if the file name is defined. These particles may be read in in a later CORSIKA-run established with the STACKIN option (see Sect. 3.5.29 page 56).

para.name: MODATM
para.desc: Gives the number of the atmospheric parameterization. See page 69 for a list.

para.name: IATMOX
para.desc: MODTRAN Atmospheric model. This requires a file named atmprofi.dat to be present in CORSIKA directory.

para.name: FREFRX
para.desc: If .true., the atmospheric refraction for Cherenkov photons is taken into account (for plane-parallel atmosphere); if .false., refraction is ignored.

para.name: BX
para.desc: Is the horizontal component of the Earth’s magnetic field (in μT) to the x-direction of the coordinate system (North) (see Fig. 1 page 108)

para.name: BZ
para.desc: Is the vertical component of the Earth’s magnetic field (in μT) downwards.

setting.name: GCOORD
setting.desc: Experiment Coordinates for Pre-Showering and CONEX

setting.name: ECUTS
setting.desc: Energy Cut-Offs: The low energy cut-off (in GeV) of the particle kinetic energy

para.name: ELCUT1
para.desc: Hadron

para.name: ELCUT2
para.desc: Muon

para.name: ELCUT3
para.desc: Electron

para.name: ELCUT4
para.desc: Photon and pi0

para.name: XSHCORE
para.desc: Detector position in x-direction (in meter) of the ith scattering relative to the shower core.

para.name: YSHCORE
para.desc: Detector position in y-direction (in meter) of the ith scattering relative to the shower core.

para.name: MAXPRT
para.desc: Is the maximum number of events that produce a detailed printout during the simulation run.

para.name: ECTMAP
para.desc: Defines a cut in the particle gamma factor (or energy in GeV for em-particles and neutrinos) above which they are printed out on the logical unit MONIOU when passing an observation level.

setting.name: CUTPAR
setting.desc: Parameters of Cutted Particles for Parallel Treatment

para.name: WAVLGL
para.desc: Lower limit (in nm) of the wavelength band for Cherenkov radiation production.

para.name: WAVLGU
para.desc: Upper limit (in nm) of the wavelength band for Cherenkov radiation production.

para.name: XSCATT
para.desc: Maximum scattering of core location in +-X direction (in cm). See Sect. 3.4.1 page 36 ff.

para.name: YSCATT
para.desc: Maximum scattering of core location in +-Y direction (in cm). See Sect. 3.4.1 page 36 ff.

para.name: TYEAR
para.desc: Define the start time of the observation.

para.name: TMONTH
para.desc: Define the start time of the observation.

para.name: TDAY
para.desc: Define the start time of the observation.

para.name: THOUR
para.desc: Define the start time of the observation.

para.name: TMINUTE
para.desc: Define the start time of the observation.

para.name: TSECOND
para.desc: Define the start time of the observation.

para.name: TDURATION
para.desc: Duration of observation (in sec).

para.name: TLATDGR
para.desc: Latitude of the telescope site (in degree).

para.name: TLATMIN
para.desc: Latitude of the telescope site (in min).

para.name: TLATSEC
para.desc: Latitude of the telescope site (in sec).

para.name: TLATDIR
para.desc: Direction North = ’N’, South = ’S’ of the latitude of the telescope site.

para.name: TLONGDGR
para.desc: Longitude of the telescope site (in degree).

para.name: TLONGMIN
para.desc: Longitude of the telescope site (in min).

para.name: TLONGSEC
para.desc: Longitude of the telescope site (in sec).

para.name: TLONGDIR
para.desc: Direction East = ’E’, West = ’W’ of the longitude of the telescope site.

para.name: TRAD
para.desc: Defines the radius of a spread around the calculated trajectory (in arcmin).

para.name: ENERGY_INTER
para.desc: Threshold energy (in GeV) above which particles are interesting for production of high-energy neutrinos for the IceCube [56] experiment

para.name: PIPE_OUTPUT
para.desc: If .true., the output is redirected to a pipe-buffer. This buffer should serve as on-line input to a detector simulation program.

para.name: GZIP_OUTPUT
para.desc: If .true., the output is compressed using the gzip procedure to reduce storage space. The gain in space reduction will not be very dramatic

para.name: USER
para.desc: A user name is read in to be written to the ’DATnnnnnn.dbase’ file. Lower case characters of USER are not converted to capitals.

para.name: HOST
para.desc: A host name is read in to be written to the ’DATnnnnnn.dbase’ file. Lower case characters of HOST are not converted to capitals.
